answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Izzy – good to see you using the Knowledge Network in your new position!  I hope the following is helpful:
Rancho Palo Verdes, CA - NAMING PUBLIC FACILITIES AND PLACING OF MONUMENTS AND OTHER MEMORIALS
http://www.palosverdes.com/rpv/citycouncil/agendas/2011_Agendas/MeetingDate-2011-11-01/RPVCCA_CC_SR_2011_11_01_06_Naming_Policy.pdf 
San Jose, CA – NAMING OF CITY-OWNED LAND AND FACILITIES
http://www3.sanjoseca.gov/clerk/cp_manual/CPM_7_5.pdf 
West Linn, OR - Parks, Areas, & Facilities Naming Policy
http://westlinnoregon.gov/parksrec/parks-areas-facilities-naming-policy 
Vacaville, CA - POLICY FOR THE NAMING, DEDICATION, AND SPONSORSHIP OF CITY FACILITIES AND ACCEPTANCE OF DONATIONS -- http://www.cityofvacaville.com/modules/showdocument.aspx?documentid=1522 
Seaside, CA - PARK, RECREATIONAL FACILITY, CITY-OWNED BUILDING AND STREET NAMING POLICY
http://www.ci.seaside.ca.us/Modules/ShowDocument.aspx?documentid=505 
ICMA – Las Vegas, NV City Facilities/Property Naming Policy
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/303001/City_FacilitiesProperty_Naming_Policy
let me know if you need/want more examples!  Happy Holidays.
Pam
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Office
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
www.transformgov.org
www.tlgconference.org

author: Izzy Murguia
text: Revising the City's administrative policy for naming parks and recreation facilities. I would appreciate it if you could share your sample policies. Thank you!
title: Naming Parks and Recreation Facilities
